attributes.comment:
I disagree with the desire to implement such a drastic increase to the Immigration and
Naturalization Benefit Application and Petition Fee Schedule. We are in the process of completing
an international adoption and are presently awaiting a referral. Due to the long time-frame of the
international adoption process (a 1.5 to 2 year wait for referral), and the limited term of the USCIS
application, it ensures that many of those adopting internationally will have to apply/pay fee initially,
and then do this again to renew as the year term approaches. In the very least, if implementing a
fee increase, then increasing the term of the application from 12 months to 2 years should be
included. This won't help me at this point, but would help the process by reducing meaningless
government paperhandling involved for these renewals. Thank you for your sincere consideration of
this important matter.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Robert B. Ede
